abilities.abilityName: Buso Koka: Gomu Gomu no Bullet
abilities.description: Luffy hardens his fist with Armament Haki and delivers a devastating short-distance punch by stretching his arm back and snapping it forward.

abilities.abilityName: Atama Buso: Gomu Gomu no Kane
abilities.description: Luffy hardens his head with Armament Haki and uses it as a weapon in a powerful headbutt attack.

keyMoments.title: Buso Koka: Gomu Gomu no Bullet Debut
keyMoments.description: Luffy combines his Devil Fruit powers with Armament Haki hardening to create a devastating attack.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the evolution of Luffy's combat style combining Devil Fruit and Haki.

keyMoments.title: Atama Buso: Gomu Gomu no Kane Debut
keyMoments.description: Luffy uses Haki hardening on his head for a headbutt attack.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Luffy's versatility in applying Haki to different body parts enhanced by his rubber properties.

abilities.description: By touching a target with their palms, the user can mark them. Any object thrown by the user will then automatically home in on the marked target and cannot be stopped until it reaches them.

keyMoments.title: Unstoppable Nature of Mark-Mark Fruit Revealed
keyMoments.description: Vander Decken IX explains that whatever he throws cannot be stopped until it reaches the marked target, revealing why Noah cannot be halted.
keyMoments.significance: Clarifies the dangerous and unstoppable nature of this Devil Fruit ability, creating the crisis of the arc.

keyMoments.title: Noah Thrown at Shirahoshi
keyMoments.description: The massive ship Noah continues its unstoppable descent toward Shirahoshi due to Decken's Mark-Mark Fruit power.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the devastating potential of the Mark-Mark Fruit when used on massive objects.
